column5: At last, seven moths after my last pike I came back to the action this last monday. The shore of the sea didn´t melt down yet, but that wasn´t enough to stop me.    So I went on that 2 Celsius degrees water, and after 3 hours of pain I got 2 nice looking pikes, 75 and 83cm, not monsters, but much more that what I was expecting for that day in such a horrible conditions.      Also came on the hooks 3 bream males, one of them was my biggest in that specie until now.      And the big one.    Hope to offer you more and bigger nothern pikes soon.
What are those haha  Nice pike

83cms is still a respectable pike, especially in Southern Ontario. Further north the target is for 100cm. A lot of people here still look at pike as garbage fish, but there is nothing better for making kalamojakka.
neat looking swim bait, does it have a name??
Awesome stuff, cant wait until season opens here!  I'd love to target some Baltic pike one day too!
looks like a storm kick'n minnow
I was more interested to see the lure hanging out of the mouth of the pike.!
Nice pike and bream, can't wait to see some monster Baltic pike! Keep the reports coming!
Always nice to see an International post here.  Very interesting to see different species of fish.
Your fish are awesome, and the women of your country are even better!  Keep the reports coming!
That water looks mighty turbid..  and cold..  You must know your craft!  Those bream remind me of our fresh water drum!  Thanks for sharing
Nice fish!  Can you fish for pike through the ice? Seven months is a long time.
do they always bite with their backs? lol
Nice report. Looks like you had a great time out there.
haha they must body check the lure  Im jk, those are some nice fish

Hi guys, thanks for your comments!!!  About the breams and the weird way the are hooked, its something very common until june. Those males don´t like intruders messing around in their territory.  Hope to put more stuff soon.
I was jut pullin' your chain..  What else do you catch out there?
Most of the time I go for nothern pike, it´s my favorite. But also i spend some time after perch,brown trout, gryling, and burbot during the winter.
Nice to have you aboard Hauki, keep the reports coming. I love to see the size of some of those finish fishies. Suksi vitoon!! (Is that the right spelling) lol
